thread.title_full: WittyFeed surpasses Twitter and Instagram, becomes 20th most visited website in India - The Economic Times

author: Economictimes.Com
title: WittyFeed surpasses Twitter and Instagram, becomes 20th most visited website in India - The Economic Times
text: WittyFeed surpasses Twitter and Instagram, becomes 20th most visited website in India By ECONOMICTIMES.COM | Updated: Feb 22, 2017, 05.16 PM IST WittyFeed is an indigenous and a 100% bootstrapped company which has thrived and grown and is currently valued at $30 million. Assembly Elections 2017: Will Modi magic work in UP, Uttarakhand, Goa, Punjab & Manipur? WittyFeed, world's second largest and India's largest viral content company, on Wednesday in a statement said it has emerged as 20th most visited websites in India, surpassing most major social networking sites Twitter & Instagram and being the fastest and youngest company to attain this ranking. The latest Alexa ranking as on February 22, shows the startup as the 20th most visited website in India. Based in Indore, the company was started in 2014 from a small hostel room with the founders pushing Facebook content, but has since diversified into 18 categories including travel, inspiration, relationships, health & fitness, and celebrities. It has 21000 stories by 200 writers from across the globe to back its claim. WittyFeed is an indigenous and a 100% bootstrapped company which has thrived and grown and is currently valued at $30 million. The company registered revenues of Rs. 26 crore in the last FY and expects to cross Rs. 35 crore this year. The company is looking to expand more in the US market as it contributes to company’s 30% traffic. On this procurement Vinay Singhal, Co-Founder & CEO, WittyFeed said,"This is indeed a very significant achievement for us, and I am very glad that WittyFeed had reached to this position. It is a great achievement for our entire team to transcend some leading social networking sites just in two years. This feat motivates us to believe in ourselves and works hard to accomplish new milestones in coming years. I wish that the future holds more heights of success for WittyFeed,” said WittyFeed, Co founder & CEO, Vinay SInghal in a statement. To match up to the latest trends and viewers’ preferences, WittyFeed has also launched Web Series to engage with its audiences. It also plans to launch portals in other languages like Tamil, Marathi, Punjabi, Bengali etc. other than its English and Hindi platforms.
